Column Comment.0: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.1: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: VOLUME METHOD: The type of method used to determine the volume of flu idsmoved. Examples would be measured, prorated, engineering study, e tc.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVITY TYPE: The type of activity that caused the movement of fluid s to occursuch as production, injection, flaring, sales, etc.
Column Comment.5: PRODUCT TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of product (fluid) such asGAS, OIL, WATER, NGL, etc. Includes the less common products like STEAM,METHANE, BUTANE, HELIUM, etc.
Column Comment.6: PERIOD TYPE: A reference table identifying the length of time for which a volume isrecorded. Possible values are DAY, MONTH, YEAR.
Column Comment.7: VOLUME DISPOSITION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A number that is used touniquely identify a reported movement of fluid between two production entities.
Column Comment.8: AMENDMENT SEQUENCE NUMBER: used to order amendment events forproduction volumes. For each PDEN, volume method, acitivity type, period type andvolume date, the first row is 0. Subsequent rows are sequenced by 1, so that the fullamendment history may be recreated. When supporting amendments, rows areusually not editable once entered. Instead, new rows are created that track theamended record.
Column Comment.9: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.10: PDEN AMENDMENT REASON: The reason why a production amendment wasposted, such as instrument calibration, calculation error or volume balancing.
Column Comment.11: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.12: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.14: POSTED DATE: The date that this volume was posted, not necessarily the samedate as the volume is loaded into the database. This date is used to determine whennew volumes, such as amendments, were added to the database.
Column Comment.15: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.16: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.17: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.18: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.19: REPORT IND: A Y/N flag added to allow users to keep track of rows that should beincluded in reporting.
Column Comment.20: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.21: VOLUME: A volume of fluid that had moved between two points.
Column Comment.22: VOLUME END DATE: The date when the movement of fluid ended or the terminationdate of the fluid report.
Column Comment.23: VOLUME END DATE DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level ofprecision in the DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM orYYYYMMDD
Column Comment.24: VOLUME OUOM: Volume original unit of measure.
Column Comment.25: VOLUME PERIOD: The duration over which a movement of fluid between twoproduction entities took place.
Column Comment.26: VOLUME PERIOD OUOM: Period on original unit of measure.
Column Comment.27: VOLUME QUALITY: Value for the thermal quality of the fluid reported. This is oftenrecorded in British Thermal Units (BTUs) and can be used to calculate the Barrel ofOil Equivalent (BOE).
Column Comment.28: VOLUME QUALITY OUOM: Volume quality original unit of measure.
Column Comment.29: VOLUME START DATE: The date when the movement of fluid started or the startdate of the fluid report.
Column Comment.31: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.32: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.33: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.34: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.35: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.36: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.37: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
